summary: The document is a classified message from September 1970, released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It details a report about the Organization of Arab Students in the U.S. enlisting Ishmael Flory, a CPUSA official in Illinois, to select five young Black Americans for a propagandistic tour of the Middle East, specifically Jordan and the UAR (United Arab Republic), aimed at influencing Black Americans' views on the Arab position. The tour was scheduled to depart from Chicago on 24 August 1970, with arrangements handled in Chicago and tickets pre-paid from Amman. The message also seeks information on the participants' travel, contacts, and activities, indicating the U.S. government's monitoring interest.
key_findings: The document reveals a strategic effort by the Organization of Arab Students in the U.S. to shape Black Americans' perceptions of the Arab position through a sponsored Middle East tour.
It highlights the role of CPUSA official Ishmael Flory in selecting the tour participants, indicating a link between the Communist Party USA and this initiative.
The message reflects the U.S. government's surveillance and interest in the activities and international contacts of the individuals involved in this program.
